name.text: Finding Trigonometric Ratios in a Right-Angled Triangle

questiontext.text:
Find the values of the \(\sin(\theta)\), \(\cos(\theta)\), and \(\tan ( \theta)\) in the given right-angled triangle if \(AB\) is of length \({@AB@}\) and \(BC\) is of length \({@BC@}\).  Enter exact values, using e.g. sqrt(2) for \(\sqrt{2}\).


\(\sin(\theta) = \) [[input:ans1]]; [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

\(\cos(\theta) = \) [[input:ans2]]; [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

\(\tan ( \theta) = \)[[input:ans3]]. [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]

generalfeedback.text: By Pythagoras the length of the hypotenuse \(AC\) is \[\sqrt{AB^2 + BC^2} = \sqrt{{@AB@}^2 + {@BC@}^2} = {@AC@}.\]The trignometric values are then\begin{align*}\sin(\theta) &= \frac{AB}{AC} = \frac{{@AB@}}{{@AC@}}\\ \cos(\theta) &= \frac{BC}{AC} = \frac{{@BC@}}{{@AC@}}, \ \text{and}\\ \tan(\theta) &= \frac{AB}{BC} = \frac{{@AB@}}{{@BC@}}.\end{align*}

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
